string-array.name: questions
string-array.item: How do I list my books?
Can I have multiple books under one listing?
How should I price what I put up?
I found a book I want. What should I do?
What should I do after I’ve sold / given my book?
Can I make payments through the app?
Do you charge / take commission for using your platform?
Can I post non-academics books, like storybooks?

string-array.name: answers
string-array.item: BookSyndy is a platform connecting you with people who have the books you need and people who need your books. We strive to make sure no book goes obsolete. You can sell or give away your old books on our platform, and buy or take books you need.

Tap the blue floating plus button in the home screen. If you’re using guided mode, you’ll be guided through the process and asked one question per screen. If guided mode is not enabled, you’ll be shown a single screen where you can enter your book’s details.
No. Unless the books are different parts of the same book/series, you are not advised to list multiple books together.

We recommend you to keep your prices nominal and as low as possible. For example, if you’re selling your old textbook that initially costed Rs. 100, it would be reasonable to list it at Rs. 50. Needless to say, a book with a lower price is more likely to be bought than one with a higher price. If you feel a book is no longer of any use to you and feel generous enough to give it for free, please do so.

You can message the seller by clicking the blue message button in the app. Once you’ve reached an agreement with the seller, you can either request them to ship the book to you using a local logistics service, or meet them in person.
Make sure to click the ‘Mark as sold’ option from the menu so buyers know it has been taken.
No. This platform is entirely free for everyone to use.
Not as of now. BookSyndy currently focuses deeply on academics, to help students find what they need. If you feel we should accept a broader range of books, do let us know in the feedback section.
